Wyke–Aycinena Convention of $YEAR$

Our foreign minister Pedro de Aycinena y Piñol has negotiated a deal with British Consul Charles Lennox Wyke. In exchange for our acknowledgement that the territory between the Belize and Sarstoon Rivers is a part of the British settlement, and not $COUNTRY$, the British will allow us to purchase needed weapons and to build a road between Ciudad de Guatemala and Belize Town to improve communication with our Atlantic coast.
I don’t think we’ll ever get that road.

We cannot afford for this to escalate.

The Freistaat Banat

Ever since the early 1700s Germans from mainly Lorraine have been settling in the areas of Banat and Vojvodina. When Germany recently unified with the Austrian Empire the Region was left to Hungary without any guarantee for protection of the German minorities and their culture. A grave mistake which eventually lead to war between the newly formed German Empire and Hungary which, among other things, concluded in the formation of the Freistaat Banat.

The Freistaat Siebenbuergen

In the 12th century King Geza II of Hungary (reigned 1141â€“62) invited Germans to settle and defend relatively sparsely populated Transylvania. Ever since then Transylvania, known as Siebenbuergen to its German settlers, had a sizeable German minority. When Germany recently unified with the Austrian Empire the Region was left to Hungary without any guarantee for protection of the German minorities and their culture. A grave mistake which eventually lead to war between the newly formed German Empire and Hungary which, among other things, concluded in the formation of the Freistaat Siebenbuergen.
Interesting
The return of the Habsburgs

Despite being nominally still ruled by the Habsburg Monarch for a long time after its independence, said King never had true power over "his" government ever since Hungary seperated from Austria. With the conclusion of the war with Germany the Habsburgs were returned to true power in Hungary, as a proxy for the interests of the newly formed greater Germany of course. Since the von Habsburg Monarch also rules the Archduchy of Austria within the German Empire the fate of Hungary is tied to that of Germany as long as this arrangement lasts.
As it should be

Germans in Hungary

The region of Burgenland and the City of Pressburg are populated by mostly Germans. Furthermore the fertile farmlands of Banat and the mountains of Transylvania have sizeable German minoritys that have been settling there for centuries. Our goal should be to unite Burgenland and Pressburg with Germany and create states for the German settlers in Banat and Transylvania. In addition to this the von Habsburg Family has asked us to use this opportunity to restore their candidate for the Hungarian throne to absolute power. This would make Hungary a clientstate for all intends and purposes. However first we must choose a strategy to approach Hungary with.
We tell them what we want and if they refuse we invade!

Both delegations met in Eisenstadt to discuss the return of Burgenland to German rule and the meeting went smoothly. The German delegations goal was of course the unconditional return of all of Burgenland whilst the Hungarian delegation was instructed to push for the sale of the German part of Burgenland for 100000 pounds. When the meeting was nearing its end the final act of the German delegation was...

Germany and Hungary at the table in Temeschburg

Once again we have met with Hungarian negotiators to determine the fate of yet another part of their newly independent country. After calm and mannered Negotiations everyone saw the arguments for the establishment for a Freistaat in Banat, yet its exact borders were a point of tension as the german settlement area streches all the way to Vojvodina, a region which regrettably also has a large Hungarian population and would therefore be hard to wrangle from Hungary. Whatever is negotiated here the Hungarian government also has to ratify. But for what its worth the conference defined the borders of the Freistaat Banat as....

Freistaat Banat Introduction

Ever since the early 1700s Germans from mainly Lorraine have been settling in the areas of Banat and Vojvodina. When Germany recently unified with the Austrian Empire the Region was left to Hungary without any guarantee for protection of the German minorities and their culture. A grave mistake which lead to a series of conferences and negotiations about the status of those settlers. The most recent one of those concluded in the formation of the Freistaat Banat.

The Freistaat Siebenbürgen

In the 12th century King Geza II of Hungary (reigned 1141â€“62) invited Germans to settle and defend relatively sparsely populated Transylvania. Ever since then Transylvania, known as Siebenbuergen to its German settlers, had a sizeable German minority. As part of our larger effort to diplomatically solve the issue of the Germans in Hungary we have managed to secure the creating of the Freistaat Siebenbürgen, an autonomous state within Hungary for the Germans and Romanians of Transylvania.
